intro: Deanea montana, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture. Deanea montana thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests.
